Kural_Info.Tamil_Text: வில்லேர் உழவர் பகைகொளினும் கொள்ளற்க சொல்லேர் உழவர் பகை.
Kural_Info.English_Meaning: Though you may incur the hatred of warriors whose ploughs are bows, incur not that of ministers whose ploughs are words.

Layered_Composition.Foreground: A ruler is shown making a choice about their enemies. On the left, they are shown cautiously accepting the enmity of a group of powerful warriors, whose 'ploughs' are their bows ('வில்லேர் உழவர்').
Layered_Composition.Midground: On the right, they are shown actively trying to avoid and placate the enmity of a group of scholars or ministers, whose 'ploughs' are their powerful words ('சொல்லேர் உழவர்').
Layered_Composition.Background: The enmity of the warriors is depicted as a physical threat, like a storm of arrows, which can be defended against. The enmity of the word-wielders is shown as a more dangerous, insidious threat, like a poison that corrupts the land and turns the people against the ruler.

Art_Direction.Subject_and_Action: It is better to make an enemy of a warrior than to make an enemy of a man of words.
Art_Direction.Symbolic_Motifs: The contrast between the two types of 'ploughs'—the bow and the word—is key. The different natures of their threats (arrows vs. poison/corruption) illustrates why the enmity of the man of words is more dangerous.
Art_Direction.Mood_and_Emotion: Strategic, cautionary, a comparison of threats.
Art_Direction.Lighting_and_Color: The warrior's threat is fiery and direct. The word-wielder's threat is a subtle, sickly, poisonous green that spreads unseen.

Technical_Cues.Camera: A split composition showing the ruler facing the two different types of enemies and their respective threats.
Technical_Cues.Lighting: Contrasting lighting for the two types of threat.

Cultural_Anchors: The superior power of intellectual enmity.

Flux_Optimized_Prompt.Negative_Prompt: ruler fighting the scholars and befriending the warriors, text artifacts.

Hyperparameters.seed: Explore variations for the 'poison of words'.
